intro: Chailletia subcordata, commonly known as the broad-leaved chailletia, is a rare and distinctive plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically broad and lobed, giving it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
